intro: Calceolaria dentata var. cummingiana, commonly known as the toothed slipper orchid, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, particularly in regions of Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are often brightly colored, ranging from violet to orange. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. The leaves are typically narrow and slightly toothed, giving the species its scientific name.
